title: Lesson 11
paragraph: Careers and services flourish when professionals are bold, capable, and attentive. Compensating fairly, assisting colleagues, and revealing insights allow careers to develop and organizations to thrive.

words.meaning: showing courage or willingness to take risks
words.example: She made a bold decision to start her own company.

words.meaning: a piece of writing expressing ideas and feelings in a structured way
words.example: He wrote a poem to express his love.

words.meaning: to give someone something in recognition of loss or effort
words.example: The company compensated employees for overtime work.

words.meaning: a place, equipment, or service provided for a particular purpose
words.example: The gym has excellent training facilities.

words.meaning: a tendency to favor or oppose something unfairly
words.example: The judge remained free of bias during the trial.
Volunteers assisted the elderly with shopping.
The company hired new engineers last month.

words.meaning: the maximum amount something can contain or produce
words.example: The stadium has a seating capacity of 50,000.

words.meaning: someone focused on advancing their career
words.example: He was seen as a careerist in the corporate world.

words.meaning: to make known or disclose something
words.example: She revealed her plans to start a new business.
